 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂבֵעַ‎</span>,] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂבַע‎</span><sub>96</sub> **verb** ==be sated, satisfied, surfeited== (Late Hebrew (derived species) = Biblical Hebrew; so Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šebû***</u></abbr>, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סְבַע‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שבע‎</span>; the Ethiopic verb of same, meaning is <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">:); — 

**Qal**<sub>79</sub> ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂבַע‎</span> [[1Chr.23.1|1Chr 23:1]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְשׂ‎</span> consecutive [[Deut.31.20|Deut 31:20]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂבֵ֑עוּ‎</span> [[Isa.9.19|Isa 9:19]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ושׂ‎</span> consecutive [[Deut.14.29|Deut 14:29]]; [[Deut.26.12|Deut 26:12]], etc.; ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִשְׂבַּע‎</span> [[Prov.12.11|Prov 12:11]] +, 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִשְׂבְּעוּן‎</span> [[Ps.104.28|Ps 104:28]], etc.; ***Imperative*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׂבַעֿ‎</span> [[Prov.20.13|Prov 20:13]] ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂבוֺע‎</span> [[Joel.2.26|Joel 2:26]]; [[2Chr.31.10|2Chr 31:10]] construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִשְׂבֹּע‎</span> [[Exod.16.8|Exod 16:8]]; [[Lam.5.6|Lam 5:6]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְשָׂבְעָה‎</span> [[Hag.1.6|Hag 1:6]] — 

**1.** ***be sated*** (with food), especially human subject: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** absolute after <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָכַל‎</span>, [[Hos.4.10|Hos 4:10]]; [[Isa.9.19|Isa 9:19]]; [[Deut.8.10|Deut 8:10]]; [[Exod.16.8|Exod 16:8]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), + II t., compare [[Isa.44.16|Isa 44:16]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָבַל‎</span>); exposing men to arrogance [[Deut.6.11|Deut 6:11]]; [[Deut.8.12|Deut 8:12]]; [[Deut.31.20|Deut 31:20]], compare [[Hos.13.6|Hos 13:6]] (twice in verse) (Israel under figure of cattle), [[Jer.50.19|Jer 50:19]] (id.; with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ב‎</span> location; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָעָה‎</span> ***graze***); = have (or get) enough to eat [[Ps.37.19|Ps 37:19]]; [[Ps.59.16|Ps 59:16]], enough to drink [[Amos.4.8|Amos 4:8]], figurative of sword [[Jer.46.10|Jer 46:10]], of wine [[Hab.2.5|Hab 2:5]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** with accusative of food [[Jer.44.17|Jer 44:17]]; [[Lam.5.16|Lam 5:16]]; [[Exod.16.12|Exod 16:12]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), + 6 t., compare [[Ezek.39.29|Ezek 39:29]] (of beasts, in figure), of earth, sated with water (rain) [[Prov.30.16|Prov 30:16]], so of trees (accusative om) [[Ps.104.16|Ps 104:16]], figurative of requital [[Prov.18.20|Prov 18:20]] b. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span> of food [[Job.19.22|Job 19:22]] (figurative); figurative of earth having its fill (of rain) [[Ps.104.13|Ps 104:13]], and (figurative of requital) [[Prov.18.20|Prov 18:20]]a; good sense [[Prov.12.14|Prov 12:14]] (strike out <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טוֺב‎</span>, so Toy), bad sense [[Prov.1.31|Prov 1:31]]; [[Prov.14.14|Prov 14:14]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span> of source [[Isa.66.11|Isa 66:11]] (figurative). 

**2.** more generally, ***be sated***, have desire satisfied: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** absolute [[Ezek.16.28|Ezek 16:28]]; [[Ezek.16.29|Ezek 16:29]] (i.e. with harlotry), [[Jer.50.10|Jer 50:10]] (with plunder), [[Isa.53.11|Isa 53:11]] (with given result); of eyes [[Prov.27.20|Prov 27:20]], of <abbr title="transliteration"><u>Sh®°ôl</u></abbr> and Abaddon v[[Prov.27.20|Prov 27:20]], compare [[Prov.30.15|Prov 30:15]] = have abundance [[Prov.30.9|Prov 30:9]] (exposure to arrogance). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** with accusative, ***be satisfied with, have one's fill of***: [[Jer.31.14|Jer 31:14]], compare [[Ps.17.15|Ps 17:15]]; [[Ps.63.6|Ps 63:6]]; [[Prov.5.10|Prov 5:10]]; [[Eccl.5.9|Eccl 5:9]], compare (eye subject) [[Eccl.4.8|Eccl 4:8]] Acc. of sons [[Ps.17.14|Ps 17:14]] (si versa l., but text dubious, see [[BDB#Ol|Ol]] [[BDB#Du|Du]], compare [[BDB#Bae|Bae]] [[BDB#We|We]]), days of life, i.e. reach the full limit (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זָקֵן‎</span>) [[1Chr.23.1|1Chr 23:1]]; [[2Chr.24.15|2Chr 24:15]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ב‎</span> of goodness [[Ps.65.5|Ps 65:5]], with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span> id. [[Eccl.6.3|Eccl 6:3]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ל‎</span> infinitive, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לאֹתִֿשְׂבַּע עַיִן לִרְאוֺת‎</span> [[Eccl.1.8|Eccl 1:8]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָלֵא‎</span>) 

**3.** ***have in excess, be surfeited with:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** lit, with honey (accusative) [[Prov.25.16|Prov 25:16]]. **b** figurative = ***be weary of***, with accusative of offerings [[Isa.1.11|Isa 1:11]] (subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>), tossings [[Job.7.4|Job 7:4]], poverty [[Prov.28.19|Prov 28:19]], shame [[Hab.2.16|Hab 2:16]], contempt [[Ps.123.3|Ps 123:3]]; [[Ps.123.4|Ps 123:4]] with accusative of person [[Prov.28.17|Prov 28:17]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** id., with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ב‎</span> of troubles [[Ps.88.4|Ps 88:4]], of reproach [[Lam.3.30|Lam 3:30]]. **Niph\`al** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִשְׂבָּע‎</span> ***sated*** [[Job.31.31|Job 31:31]]. **Pi\`el** ***satisfy***, ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְשַׂבִּ֑עוּ‎</span> [[Ezek.7.19|Ezek 7:19]] ***they shall*** not ***satisfy*** their appitite (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶפֶשׁ‎</span>; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִלֵּא‎</span>); ***Imperative*** masculine singular suffix, subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׂבְּעֵנִי חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ‎</span> [[Ps.90.14|Ps 90:14]] (2 accusative). **\*\***Now (after <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ6‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵐ5‎</span> Manuscripts) reads <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִבַּעְתָּ‎</span> [[Hab.3.9|Hab 3:9]], for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁבֻעוֺת‎</span>, compare GASm; Gr Marti <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׂבֵעַת‎</span> (adjective feminine construct) thy bow is ***sated*** with shafts. We thinks hopeless. **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִשְׂבִּיע‎</span> [[Ps.107.9|Ps 107:9]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְה‎</span> consecutive [[Isa.58.11|Isa 58:11]] 2 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִשְׂבַּ֫עַתְּ‎</span> [[Ezek.27.33|Ezek 27:33]], etc.; ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַשְׂבִּעַנִי‎</span> [[Job.9.18|Job 9:18]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּשְׂבִּיעַ‎</span> [[Isa.58.10|Isa 58:10]], 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וָאַשְׂבִּעַ‎</span> [[Jer.5.7|Jer 5:7]], suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַשְׂבִּיעֶ֑ךָּ‎</span> [[Ps.81.17|Ps 81:17]] [[BDB#van d.H.|van d. H.]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַשְׂבִּיעֶ֑ךָֿ‎</span> [[BDB#Baer|Baer]] [[BDB#Gi|Gi]], etc.; ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְהַשְׂבִּיעַ‎</span> [[Job.38.27|Job 38:27]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַשְׂבִּיעַ‎</span> [[Ps.103.5|Ps 103:5]]; [[Ps.145.16|Ps 145:16]] — 

**1.a.** ***satisfy*** (especially with material blessings), subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, with acc. person [[Jer.5.7|Jer 5:7]] (exposing men to arrogance), [[Isa.58.11|Isa 58:11]] (accusative<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶפֶשׁ‎</span>; of refreshment in drought, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ב‎</span> location, figurative of help and blessing), [[Ps.107.9|Ps 107:9]] (accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶפֶשׁ‎</span>; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִלֵּא‎</span>), compare [[Ps.103.5|Ps 103:5]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ב‎</span> instrumental, on accusative see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲדִי‎</span>); with accusative of ground [[Job.38.27|Job 38:27]] (i.e. with rain); human subject, with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶפֶשׁ‎</span> [[Isa.58.10|Isa 58:10]] 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** with accusative of food + person, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> subject, [[Ps.81.17|Ps 81:17]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶאֱכִיל‎</span>), [[Ps.105.40|Ps 105:40]]; [[Ps.132.15|Ps 132:15]]; [[Ps.147.14|Ps 147:14]] with accusative of person + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֹרֶךְ יָמִים‎</span> [[Ps.91.16|Ps 91:16]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> subject, accusative of thing + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ל‎</span> person, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְבָלחַֿי רָצוֺן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַשׂ‎</span> [[Ps.145.16|Ps 145:16]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> subject, c accusative of beast + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִמְּךָ‎</span> (of Pharaoh, in prophetic figurative) [[Ezek.32.4|Ezek 32:4]]. 

**2.** ***enrich*** subject Tyre, with accusative of a people [[Ezek.27.33|Ezek 27:33]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶעֱשִׁיר‎</span>). 

**3.** ***sate, glut*** (with the undesired), subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, with accusative of person + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ב‎</span> of thing [[Lam.3.15|Lam 3:15]], accusative of person + [[Job.9.18|Job 9:18]].
